title: The twins who tricked the Maya gods of death - Ilan Stavans

multiple-choice.question: What was the reason for the twin brothers, Jun and Wuqub, being challenged by the lords of the underworld?

options.label: A
options.text: They had stolen the ballgame equipment from the underworld.

options.label: B
options.text: They had disturbed the lords while playing ball.

options.label: C
options.text: They had refused to play the ballgame with the lords.

options.label: D
options.text: They had killed the lords' daughters.

multiple-choice.question: What happened to Junajpu after he was bitten by a bat in the House of Bats?

options.label: A
options.text: He was healed by the seers.

options.label: B
options.text: He was restored to life by the river.

options.label: C
options.text: He lost his head, but was later reattached.

options.label: D
options.text: He was not affected by the bat bite.

multiple-choice.question: Why did the twins, Junajpu and Ixb'alanke, agree to play the ballgame with the lords again after the first round?

options.label: A
options.text: They were confident of winning.

options.label: B
options.text: They were sure this would be no ordinary match.

options.label: C
options.text: They were trying to trick the lords.

options.label: D
options.text: They were tired of playing.

multiple-choice.question: What was the twins' strategy to survive the House of Darkness?

options.label: A
options.text: They lit a fire to keep warm.

options.label: B
options.text: They adorned the torch with red macaw feathers and fireflies.

options.label: C
options.text: They hid in the shadows.

options.label: D
options.text: They played a game of hide-and-seek.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the twins' final trick, where Ixb'alanke pretended to kill Junajpu and then resurrect him?

options.label: A
options.text: The lords were impressed and asked for more tricks.

options.label: B
options.text: The lords were angry and demanded a rematch.

options.label: C
options.text: The lords were delighted and begged for mercy.

options.label: D
options.text: The twins were punished for their trickery.

multiple-choice.question: What was the curse spoken by the twins to the lords after they realized who stood before them?

options.label: A
options.text: The lords would have to play the ballgame with the twins every year.

options.label: B
options.text: The lords would have no sacrifices and no power over the surface world.

options.label: C
options.text: The lords would be forced to live in the underworld forever.

options.label: D
options.text: The lords would be turned into animals.

multiple-choice.question: What happened to the remains of the twins after they were burned in an oven?

options.label: A
options.text: They were buried in the underworld.

options.label: B
options.text: They were thrown in the river, which restored them to life.

options.label: C
options.text: They were taken to the House of Bats.

options.label: D
options.text: They were kept in the House of Darkness.

multiple-choice.question: Who helped the twins survive the supernatural trials set by the lords?

options.label: A
options.text: The seers.

options.label: B
options.text: The mosquito.

options.label: C
options.text: The turtle.

options.label: D
options.text: The lords themselves.

multiple-choice.question: What was the purpose of the twins' disguise as two disheveled children when they began to dance and perform miracles?

options.label: A
options.text: To confuse the lords.

options.label: B
options.text: To impress the lords.

options.label: C
options.text: To beg for mercy.

options.label: D
options.text: To perform their final trick.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the ballgame between the twins and the lords?

options.label: A
options.text: The twins won, and the lords were impressed.

options.label: B
options.text: The twins lost, and the lords were angry.

options.label: C
options.text: The twins won, and the lords were delighted.

options.label: D
options.text: The game was a tie, and the twins had to face another supernatural trial.

title: The sleep disorder you might not know you have - Alayna Vaughan

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of snoring?

options.label: A
options.text: Congestion in the respiratory tract

options.label: B
options.text: Narrowing of the airway due to relaxed muscles

options.label: C
options.text: Blockages in the airway

options.label: D
options.text: Temporary failure of the brain to regulate breathing

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated percentage of people who suffer from obstructive sleep apnea without being aware of it?
What is one of the main features of central sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Pauses in breathing during sleep

options.label: B
options.text: Snoring

options.label: C
options.text: Temporary failure of the brain to regulate breathing

options.label: D
options.text: Narrowing of the airway

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary effect of obstructive sleep apnea on the body?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased oxygen intake

options.label: B
options.text: Reduced blood pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased stress hormones

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced oxygen intake, leading to increased stress hormones and blood pressure

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one of the main contributors to obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Drinking alcohol before sleep

options.label: B
options.text: Weight gain

options.label: C
options.text: Larger tongues

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential solution to obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Surgery

options.label: B
options.text: CPAP machines

options.label: C
options.text: Weight loss

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: What are some potential consequences of obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Headaches, decreased concentration, and chronic fatigue

options.label: B
options.text: Increased oxygen intake

options.label: C
options.text: Reduced blood pressure

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one of the main differences between obstructive sleep apnea and central sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is caused by blockages in the airway, while central sleep apnea is caused by temporary failure of the brain to regulate breathing

options.label: B
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is characterized by pauses in breathing during sleep, while central sleep apnea is characterized by snoring

options.label: C
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is mainly caused by congestion in the respiratory tract, while central sleep apnea is mainly caused by narrowing of the airway

options.label: D
options.text: Obstructive sleep apnea is caused by temporary failure of the brain to regulate breathing, while central sleep apnea is caused by blockages in the airway

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential treatment for obstructive sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: CPAP machines

options.label: B
options.text: Surgery

options.label: C
options.text: Weight loss

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one of the main reasons why obstructive sleep apnea is a serious condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It can lead to increased oxygen intake

options.label: B
options.text: It can lead to reduced blood pressure

options.label: C
options.text: It can lead to reduced oxygen intake, increased stress hormones, and increased blood pressure

options.label: D
options.text: It can lead to headaches, decreased concentration, and chronic fatigue

title: 3 secrets of resilient people - Lucy Hone

multiple-choice.question: What was the author's initial reaction to the advice given to her after her daughter's death?

options.label: A
options.text: She was grateful for the support and guidance.

options.label: B
options.text: She felt empowered to take control of her grief.

options.label: C
options.text: She felt overwhelmed and powerless.

options.label: D
options.text: She was angry and angry at the advice given.

options.label: A
options.text: Abi

options.label: B
options.text: Ella

options.label: C
options.text: Sally

options.label: D
options.text: Emily

multiple-choice.question: According to the author, what is a vital skill for resilience?

options.label: A
options.text: Being able to focus on the good things in life.

options.label: B
options.text: Being able to choose carefully where to select attention.

options.label: C
options.text: Being able to accept the things that cannot be changed.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the strategy that involves finding things to be grateful for?

options.label: A
options.text: Benefit finding

options.label: B
options.text: Resilience

options.label: C
options.text: Positive thinking

options.label: D
options.text: Gratitude practice

multiple-choice.question: In the study conducted by Martin Seligman and colleagues, what was the result of people thinking of three good things that had happened to them each day?

options.label: A
options.text: They showed higher levels of depression.

options.label: B
options.text: They showed higher levels of happiness and less depression.

options.label: C
options.text: They showed no change in their emotional state.

options.label: D
options.text: They showed a decrease in their overall well-being.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the strategy that involves asking oneself whether what they're doing is helping or harming them?

options.label: A
options.text: Benefit finding

options.label: B
options.text: Resilience

options.label: C
options.text: Self-reflection

options.label: D
options.text: Harmful or helpful

multiple-choice.question: According to the author, what is the most powerful strategy she has learned from her experiences?

options.label: A
options.text: Benefit finding

options.label: B
options.text: Resilience

options.label: C
options.text: Positive thinking

options.label: D
options.text: Asking oneself whether what they're doing is helping or harming them

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's message to people who are going through a difficult time in their lives?

options.label: A
options.text: That they should try to forget their past and move on.

options.label: B
options.text: That they should focus on the good things in life.

options.label: C
options.text: That they should ask themselves whether what they're doing is helping or harming them.

options.label: D
options.text: That they should try to be more resilient.

multiple-choice.question: According to the author, what is the key to resilience?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a fixed trait that some people have and some people don't.

options.label: B
options.text: It's a skill that can be learned and developed.

options.label: C
options.text: It's a combination of both fixed and learned traits.

options.label: D
options.text: It's not possible to develop resilience.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's main message in her talk?

options.label: A
options.text: That people should try to be more resilient.

options.label: B
options.text: That people should focus on the good things in life.

options.label: C
options.text: That people should ask themselves whether what they're doing is helping or harming them.

options.label: D
options.text: That people should learn to live and grieve at the same time.

title: The secrets of the world’s most famous symphony - Hanako Sawada

multiple-choice.question: What was the premiere of Beethoven's Symphony Number Five like?

options.label: A
options.text: It was a grand event with a large audience and a well-rehearsed orchestra.

options.label: B
options.text: It was a hastily assembled and under-rehearsed performance on a cold Vienna night.

options.label: C
options.text: It was a private event held for Beethoven's wealthy patrons.

options.label: D
options.text: It was a concert held exclusively for religious functions.

multiple-choice.question: What made Beethoven's Fifth Symphony so captivating?

options.label: A
options.text: Its complex musical structure and instrumentation.

options.label: B
options.text: Its expressive melodies and extended forms.

options.label: C
options.text: Its ability to evoke powerful emotions in listeners.

options.label: D
options.text: Its connection to Beethoven's personal life and struggles.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main innovation in Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?

options.label: A
options.text: Its use of a high-pitched piccolo and a low-pitched contrabassoon.

options.label: B
options.text: Its employment of trombones in a major orchestral composition.

options.label: C
options.text: Its experimental use of Romanticism in a Classical sonata form.

options.label: D
options.text: Its dramatic musical dynamics and exaggerated instrumentation.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the "fate motif" in Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?

options.label: A
options.text: It was a symbol of Beethoven's personal struggles with hearing loss.

options.label: B
options.text: It was a representation of the figure of fate knocking at the door.

options.label: C
options.text: It was a musical representation of the symphony's triumphant C major ending.

options.label: D
options.text: It was a recurring musical pattern that created forward movement and tension.

multiple-choice.question: What was the emotional arc of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?

options.label: A
options.text: It began in a triumphant C major and ended in a somber C minor.

options.label: B
options.text: It began in a somber C minor and ended in a triumphant C major.

options.label: C
options.text: It remained consistent in its emotional tone throughout the composition.

options.label: D
options.text: It had no discernible emotional arc.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony in World War II?

options.label: A
options.text: It was a symbol of defeat and surrender.

options.label: B
options.text: It was a code for victory amongst the Allies.

options.label: C
options.text: It was a representation of the war's devastating effects on civilians.

options.label: D
options.text: It was a musical representation of the war's military strategies.

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of Beethoven's hearing loss on his music?

options.label: A
options.text: It led to a decrease in his musical creativity and innovation.

options.label: B
options.text: It had no impact on his music, as he continued to compose until his death.

options.label: C
options.text: It led to a change in his musical style, with a greater emphasis on raw emotionality.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to a decrease in his musical output, as he became less productive.

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the fate motif in Morse code?

options.label: A
options.text: It represented a message of hope and resilience.

options.label: B
options.text: It represented a message of defeat and surrender.

options.label: C
options.text: It represented the letter V in Morse code.

options.label: D
options.text: It had no significance in Morse code.

multiple-choice.question: What was the impact of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony on popular culture?

options.label: A
options.text: It has been used in film scores and has become a symbol of suspense and revelation.

options.label: B
options.text: It has been used in music videos and has become a symbol of triumph and victory.

options.label: C
options.text: It has been used in video games and has become a symbol of defeat and surrender.

options.label: D
options.text: It has had no impact on popular culture.

multiple-choice.question: What was the legacy of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony?

options.label: A
options.text: It has continued to be performed and admired by audiences around the world.

options.label: B
options.text: It has been forgotten and is no longer relevant in modern music.

options.label: C
options.text: It has been surpassed by other classical compositions and is no longer considered a masterpiece.

options.label: D
options.text: It has had no lasting impact on music or culture.

options.label: B
options.text: The New Deal partially recovered the US economy.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.text: By allowing them to organize and negotiate with employers.

options.label: C
options.text: By challenging the racist leadership of the Democratic Party and laying the groundwork for an emerging civil rights coalition.

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What were some of the long-term effects of the New Deal on Black communities?

options.label: A
options.text: The New Deal helped to reduce racial inequality and improve living conditions for Black Americans.

options.label: B
options.text: The New Deal had no long-term effects on Black communities.

options.label: C
options.text: The New Deal contributed to the persistence of racial inequality and ongoing struggles for Black Americans.

options.label: D
options.text: The New Deal created a new class of Black Americans who were better off than before.

multiple-choice.question: What can be learned from the New Deal's impact on Black communities?

options.label: A
options.text: That the New Deal was a success in reducing racial inequality.

options.label: B
options.text: That the New Deal had no impact on Black communities.

options.label: C
options.text: That the New Deal's impact on Black communities was complex and multifaceted, with both positive and negative effects.

options.label: D
options.text: That the New Deal was a failure in addressing the needs of Black Americans.
